Me: You should buy Counter Strike
Someone else: Why?
Me: Because it's Counter Strike

This game is VERY VERY different to the other ones. I feel this one kind of lacks gameplay wise, as (Spoilers) Its just a bunch of minigames each night (Not the shooting ones). valve has clearly put alot more dedication into Story for this one, and while i feel thats a nice turn from the rest of the series, i personally don't like it. 

Overall, really nice effort with the minigames and voice acting, if valve ever made another cs game, however, I think it should go back to the old gameplay style, while keeping similar elements such as voice acting.

Reccomended if you like Deep stories.

Counter-Strike: Condition Zero is a bare bones, single player focused mod of the famous Counter-Strike mod for Half-Life. There are a total of 18 missions (not including ones made by users) that you can tackle along with 4 difficulty settings. Each mission is set on a different map and the variety of locales is definitely a plus. There are three objectives for each mission and in order to complete the mission you must accomplish the objectives AND beat the Terrorists by at least 2 rounds. However, the AI can be completely wonky at times which is more of a detriment to you than the opponent (especially on the later missions when the teams are unbalanced, e.g. 8 vs. 6). It can be pretty infuriating losing because the AI spent 30 seconds crouched in a corner then walks right by a person from the enemy team without even noticing them. Due to this, trying to complete the later difficulties is an extreme undertaking and requires a great deal of skill to carry your team to victory while still accomplishing all the objectives. Especially since the objectives change with each difficulty setting and some of the later ones are ridiculous (e.g. "get a kill with a knife and survive the round", or "kill an enemy blinded from a flashbang and survive the round"). Overall, it's a fun unique experience for fans of the original Counter-Strike that are looking for a more single player oriented game, but that does not make up for the lack of content and poor AI. 

6.5/10

Now as for the Deleted Scenes portion....that part is fantastic. You play through 12+ missions each with specific objectives and settings that are surprisingly detailed (for the time this game was released). The set-pieces and little reactions some of the enemies have as they die, such as plummeting out of a window to fall on and be impaled by a spire, are really a great touch. This is where the love and care went when this game was made. Fans of Counter Strike should definitely check it out.

8/10

[h1]Counter-Strike: Condition Zero[/h1]

When I got this game, I thought it was going to be something like "Source" or "1.6" but this is totally different, I find this game's singleplayer to be very enjoyable with minor difficulty, picking your own bot team with their personal stats is very cool and I would love to see something like this in "GO". [b]7/10[/b]
Absolutely the white man's choice of CS. No joke, it's the best; pure upgrade of CS 1.6 through and through.
I suggest "Counter-Strike: Source" instead of that garbage.

This is a review for CS:CZ: Deleted Scenes. This game is 14 years old and is better than most modern military shooters, you actually have to give some thought and solve problems to progress in the level sometimes. Steel crates can be moved by holding the E key. I got this with the Valve Complete Pack. Well worth a play.

Counter-Strike: Condition Zero is a great game, it's a great multiplayer FPS and everyone knows it, so I'll just talk about the 'singleplayer campaign'.

It's just bots, you and bots vs some bots. It's very simple. But, I enjoyed it a lot since building your team up from just you and a few chumps is fun, I like the basic little stats system, and I think it's a shame that the game gives you so much money to play with that you never need to do eco rounds or anything, and it seems that there's no 'campaign' for terrorists, just CTs, but... ultimately, it's fun.

As long as you're interested in just playing some bots for a while, it's fun, maybe a good warmup. Very simple. I beat all of the 'tours of duty' and none of them were very hard, I think the AI tries to make up with its lack of skill with quantity, so you can very easily counter them by picking the highest skill level guys. If you're lucky, they can even solo rounds for you, as long as you do teh challenges.

Below is my review for Counter-Strike: Condition Zero Deleted Scenes

Pretty fun singleplayer campaign, but it gets pretty repetitive and it feels like instead of the developer plotting and planning out a long string of missions to put together, everyone in the team just made a bunch of assets and then everyone went off and did their own thing.

There's a few issues.

The difficulty across missions is just all over the place, there's no ramp, some missions are hard, some are super easy. It's rare, but sometimes you'll actually just have to keep reloading saves or even reload a save from earlier in the mission if you have a hard time with something you didn't expect.

One example is the missile launcher guys. One shot from those guys is enough to basically force you to reload your save, either because you just died instantly to them or because your hp and armor are so low you're about to die anyway. The only instance I found this wasn't the case, I think, is the very last mission where there's a few missile launcher guys, but all of them are firing at you generally in locations where they won't hit something behind you. The real problem is the GIGANTIC explosion. It's just a pain since often you'll be reloading more than a handful of times.

The missions are all designed pretty well, I think, but again since it was clearly just a bunch of guys building a random assortment of levels, there's actually a lot of overlap between missions. There's quite a few missions where you have to chase down a target and shoot him until he dies. In one case, you actually have to cheese him by like nudging left and right while in cover so he doesn't fire on you while you just repeatedly headshot him. There's only a couple of stealth missions and they don't even remain stealth for very long.

The tutorial outlines a very large variety of gadgets that they want you to get accustomed to, like things such as remote detonated explosives, the defusal kit, a radio, a fibre optic cable like in SWAT for peeking under doors, and maybe one or two other gadgets I can't remember. Most stuff isn't really used that much, and not super well, the explosives are generally only used to open up a doorway so you can continue progressing, which is a shame since they could have been used for different and more interesting things, perhaps.

The M60 is absolutely busted. It has almost perfect accuracy, way better than any of the regular Counter-Strike weapons, and it recovers fast and does huge damage. As befitting a big LMG, but when in the hands of the AI it's just absolutely ridiculous, if you let them fire on you for more than a few seconds at any range, you're probably dead. While not every mission even has this gun, a few missions have them just all of the place.

A few missions are very railroaded and walking off the beaten track is either punished or impossible, but in more than a few of them you're all but required to do it just to find more stuff to keep on going. Sometimes it's just more ammo, but in some cases it's as much as a weapon drop, and in Condition Zero: Deleted Scenes, each mission only has each weapon ONCE. If you miss a weapon, that's it, you're not going to find it along the way if you didn't manage to find where it was hidden. It's not really a big deal since you can complete every mission without them, but it does make it a bit trickier when you're being given ammo for weapons you don't have.

The way armor/HP work is very punishing. Armor is usually difficult to come by, and with it most enemies will do next to no damage to you, but as it decreases, damage to your HP will rise, until at 0 enemies can kill you from full HP in only a couple of bursts if they're lucky. Headshots on you seem to sway the screen in such a way as to throw your aim off, which is extremely frustrating if you're just trying to shoot a guy and your shots all miss just because he keeps tagging you in the head.

The repetitive nature of some of the missions really kind of makes the game a bit of a struggle, and by the end they REALLY got carried away with the parkour. Having to crouch jump up a whole pile of crates to get to a ledge so you can get to a door so you can continue with the level, that's fine, but it's just weird to me that this kind of thing seems to be in ALL of the missions, numerous times, so often it feels like you're spending most of your time, most of the game in fact just jumping around cramped environments.

I have a lot of complaints, but honestly despite them all it's a great, fun singleplayer campaign, if you ever were thinking 'Counter-Strike would make a great singleplayer game' well, here you go, this is probably the best you'll ever get.
Honestly, this game is really underrated. It's like a "Campaign Mode" for Counter-Strike. There's a lot of effor put into everything here.

not a Review, just a memorable little story of this game

Since i was in Junior Highschool grade 7th (2010), there was one classmate named Bustomi has an Installation of this Game (CS:CZ), then in Friday we got a Computer Class, so we got around 25 PCs, Tomi already installed CS:CZ half of them, around 12-14 PCs (hope i remember), all my friends (Boys only) are so happy coz the Teacher absent, so our class got a chance to playing a game freely.

the game is begin, everyone ready in main Menu, Fortunately someone told the LAN Cable connected to each other's PC (with Internet connection) so we got to play "Lobby" together, then The "Lobby" is work! , hahahhaha the map we started was in "Cs_havana", i got Terrorist faction, i forgot my teammates, but i remember all my classmates who played that match, no matter what factions they got, They're Alfi, Bustomi, Dany, Rohandi, Anang, Nanda, Ian, Ryan, Rohman,& Bondan. the most Pro in this game are Ian, Rohman, Bustomi & Nanda. the most deads are Anang & Rohandi coz only camper & cant aim xD . the Pro got an special "abilty" like Bustomi always great at Rescue the Hostage, Ian has a good Tactical & Rohman has a good aim. we played so much Fun, Best moment was Bustomi only Last Man Standing to kill all enemy Team (in this time it called "ACE").we all shootin' then die and repeat until 3 Hours passed, Win or Lose it doesnt matter for us, coz we got so much fun, sadly next week the wireless cable was Disconnected coz the teacher mad to other Class for Opening Porn in Computer class LMAO,

Those day i miss so much, it doesnt matter i got win or lose. only laughing at funny moments, camping without reason, dying then no blaming to each other, all i get is fun & fun. but Things changed since CSGO, there was a raging kid, toxic player, rush B & "—Å—É–∫–∞" words

Old but fun. I recommend CS:GO but it can be awsome.

counter strike condition zero is a good game, despite the fact almost everyone hates it, its a great game to get in the bundle with cs 1.6, it features all the classic maps from 1.6 including updated versions as well, you get the ability to play against bots   right out of the gates instead of having to mod bots in like in 1.6, it features a mission mode, and it also comes packaged with the deleted scenes, which are 12 story mode missions that are quite impressive for the goldsource engine, and the guns have higher quality models, all in all this game gets a 10/10 from me as well 
its a must have for people getting cs 1.6 and condition zero bundle

An outstanding game from an outstanding publisher/developer...

This title has age a lot but not without some feel good memories, graphics are something out of a standup arcade system like Area 51 but was pretty good during it's release.

Game play is good and level design cared for, a nice throwback.

Sound engine lacks refinement and you will hear the age of this title.

Get CSGO or get this on sale.

The official sequel to the revolutionary game Counter Strike 1.6, made by Valve, the game has single player challenges with bots so playing offline is an option along with new weapons. But the main selling point is the single player campaign; deleted scenes, it takes place fighting terrorism across the globe in exotic locations. Simular to 1998 Half-Life, the campaign is still fun to play and it's story is alright.

Recommended to people who like classic games, people who play multiplayer, and people who like Half-Life style games.
